algorithms.imageProcessing.matching

Class ORBMatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.imageProcessing.matching.ORBMatcher

  • public class ORBMatcher
extends java.lang.Object
    a class to hold various methods related to matching the descriptors of ORB. See also ObjectMatcher. ORB features can be used to match 2 images as long as the number of points that are possible true matches are larger than the number of points which are not matches in the images. In other words, for the sparse feature matching approach of keypoints, need the number of possible true matches to be larger than the number of possible false matches. If that is not the case, such as in finding an object which has changed location, then the more dense approach of using blob detecter MSER is recommended. NOTE that methods are being added specifically for the sparse matching.
    Author:
    nichole
    See Also:
    ORB, ObjectMatcher

      • matchDescriptors

        public static QuadInt[] matchDescriptors(ORB.Descriptors d1,
                                         ORB.Descriptors d2,
                                         java.util.List<algorithms.util.PairInt> keypoints1,
                                         java.util.List<algorithms.util.PairInt> keypoints2)
        greedy matching of d1 to d2 by min difference, with unique mappings for all indexes. NOTE that if 2 descriptors match equally well, either one might get the assignment. Consider using instead, matchDescriptors2 which matches by descriptor and relative spatial location.
        Parameters:
        d1 -
        d2 -
        keypoints2 -
        keypoints1 -
        Returns:
        matches array of objects encapsulating a pair of matched points
